phoneLibrary.address

Class MyAddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoneLibrary.address.MyAddressBook

  • public class MyAddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    MyAddressBook represents the address book in the phone. It saves the addresses, call logs, and messages in the phone.
    Author:
    Kang Seung Won, Lee Ho Jun

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException
      This exception is thrown by MyAddressBook object if failed to load data from the XML files because it has wrong file format or not XML file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyAddressBook()
      Constructs an address book with empty data.

        public MyAddressBook()
        Constructs an address book with empty data.

    • Method Detail

      • addAddress

        public boolean addAddress(MyAddress address)
        Adds an address to the address book.
        Parameters:
        address - the address to add.
        Returns:
        true if succeeding to add, or false if failed to add the address.

      • deleteAddress

        public void deleteAddress(int index)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Deletes an address in the address book.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the address to remove in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range. (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • modifyAddress

        public boolean modifyAddress(int index,
                             MyAddress address)
                      throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Modifies an address in the address book.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the address to modify in the list.
        address - the address value to change.
        Returns:
        true if succeeding to add, or false if failed to add because the address cannot be addible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range. (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getAddress

        public MyAddress getAddress(int index)
                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the address at the specified position in the address list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the address to return.
        Returns:
        the address at the specified position in the address list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - the index is out of bounds. (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getFirstAddressIndexByName

        public int getFirstAddressIndexByName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the first address index at the specified name in the address list. If the name does not exist, returns -1.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the address to return.
        Returns:
        the first address index at the specified name in the address list or -1 if the name does not exist.

      • getAddress

        public MyAddress getAddress(PhoneNumber phoneNumber)
        Returns the address at the specified position in the address list.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - the phone number of the address to return.
        Returns:
        the address at the specified position in the list or null if the phone number does not exist.

      • getAddressListByName

        public java.util.LinkedList<MyAddress> getAddressListByName(java.lang.String stringContained)
        Returns the address that contains the specified string.
        Parameters:
        stringContained - the string to contain.
        Returns:
        the linked list of the addresses that contains the specified string.

      • getAddressListSize

        public int getAddressListSize()
        Returns the number of addresses in the book.
        Returns:
        the number of addresses in the book.

      • saveAddressListToXML

        public void saveAddressListToXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the address list as an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.

      • loadAddressListFromXML

        public int loadAddressListFromXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                  MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException
        Loads the address list from an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file to load.
        Returns:
        the number of addresses that are unloaded because it has wrong syntax. 0 if there are no unloaded addresses.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException - signals if the XML file is wrong file format for loading addresses.

      • addCallLog

        public void addCallLog(Call call)
        Adds an call log to the call log list.
        Parameters:
        call - call log to add.

      • deleteCallLog

        public void deleteCallLog(int index)
        Deletes an call log in the call log list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the call log to remove in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range. (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getCallLog

        public Call getCallLog(int index)
        Returns the call log at the specified position in the call log list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the call log to return.
        Returns:
        the call log at the specified position in the call log list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - the index is out of bounds. (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getCallLogs

        public java.util.LinkedList<Call> getCallLogs(PhoneNumber phoneNumber)
        Returns call logs that the receiver's or the sender's phone number is the specified one. The nodes of the list must be sorted in descending order by time.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - the phone number to search.
        Returns:
        linked list with call logs nodes sorted in descending order by time.

      • saveCallLogListToXML

        public void saveCallLogListToXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the call logs list as an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.

      • loadCallLogListFromXML

        public int loadCallLogListFromXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                  MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException
        Loads the call log list from an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file to load.
        Returns:
        the number of call logs that are unloaded because it has wrong syntax. 0 if there are no unloaded calls.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException - signals if the XML file is wrong file format for loading call logs.

      • getCallLogSize

        public int getCallLogSize()
        Returns the number of call logs in the book.
        Returns:
        the number of call logs in the book.

      • getMessages

        public java.util.LinkedList<Message> getMessages(PhoneNumber phoneNumber)
        Returns messages that the receiver's or the sender's phone number is the specified one. The node of the list must be sorted in descending order by time.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - the phone number to search.
        Returns:
        linked list with messages node sorted in descending order by time.

      • saveMessageListToXML

        public void saveMessageListToXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the message list as an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.

      • loadMessageListFromXML

        public int loadMessageListFromXML(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                  MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException
        Loads the message list from an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the XML file to load.
        Returns:
        the number of messages that are unloaded because it has wrong syntax. 0 if there are no unloaded messages.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals if some I/O exception at the file occurs.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        MyAddressBook.WrongFileFormatException - signals if the XML file is wrong file format for loading messages.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - signals if the file does not exist.

        Returns the number of messages in the book.
        Returns:
